member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils
member.summary: This class provides usefull text methods.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.QuoteString(System.String)
member.summary: Qoutes and escapes fishy(\") chars.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.UnQuoteString(System.String)
member.summary: Unquotes and unescapes escaped chars specified text. For example "xxx" will become to 'xxx', "escaped quote \"", will become to escaped 'quote "'.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.EscapeString(System.String,System.Char[])
member.summary: Escapes specified chars in the specified string.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.UnEscapeString(System.String)
member.summary: Unescapes all escaped chars.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.SplitQuotedString(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Splits string into string arrays. This split method won't split qouted strings, but only text outside of qouted string. For example: '"text1, text2",text3' will be 2 parts: "text1, text2" and text3.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.SplitQuotedString(System.String,System.Char,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Splits string into string arrays. This split method won't split qouted strings, but only text outside of qouted string. For example: '"text1, text2",text3' will be 2 parts: "text1, text2" and text3.
member.param: If true, splitted parst will be unqouted if they are qouted.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.QuotedIndexOf(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Gets first index of specified char. The specified char in quoted string is skipped. Returns -1 if specified char doesn't exist.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.SplitString(System.String,System.Char)
member.summary: Splits string into string arrays.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.TextUtils.IsToken(System.String)
member.summary: Gets if specified string is valid "token" value.
member.returns: Returns true if specified string value is valid "token" value.
member.exception: Is raised if value is null.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ContactParam
member.summary: Implements SIP "contact-param" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: contact-param = (name-addr / addr-spec) *(SEMI contact-params) contact-params = c-p-q / c-p-expires / contact-extension c-p-q = "q" EQUAL qvalue c-p-expires = "expires" EQUAL delta-seconds contact-extension = generic-param delta-seconds = 1*DIGIT

member.summary: Gets child entities. This property is available only if ContentType = multipart/... .

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.MimeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Mime-Version:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentClass
member.summary:
Gets or sets header field "Content-class:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.
Additional property to support messages of CalendarItem type which have iCal/vCal entries.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Type:" value. This property specifies what entity data is. NOTE: ContentType can't be changed while there is data specified(Exception is thrown) in this mime entity, because it isn't possible todo data conversion between different types. For example text/xx has charset parameter and other types don't, changing loses it and text data becomes useless.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentTypeString
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Type:" value. Returns null if value isn't set. This property specifies what entity data is. This property is meant for advanced users, who needs other values what defined MediaType_enum provides. Example value: text/plain; charset="utf-8". NOTE: ContentType can't be changed while there is data specified(Exception is thrown) in this mime entity, because it isn't possible todo data conversion between different types. For example text/xx has charset parameter and other types don't, changing loses it and text data becomes useless.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" value. This property specifies how data is encoded/decoded. If you set this value, it's recommended that you use QuotedPrintable for text and Base64 for binary data. 7bit,_8bit,Binary are today obsolete (used for parsing).

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Disposition:" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Description:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentID
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-ID:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "name" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "name" parameter isn't set.
Note: Content-Type must be application/xxx or exception is thrown. This property is obsolete today, it's replaced with Content-Disposition: filename parameter. If possible always set FileName property instead of it.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_CharSet
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "charset" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "charset" parameter isn't set. If you don't know what charset to use then utf-8 is recommended, most of times this is sufficient. Note: Content-Type must be text/xxx or exception is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_Boundary
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "boundary" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "boundary" parameter isn't set. Note: Content-Type must be multipart/xxx or exception is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDisposition_FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Disposition:" header field "filename" parameter. Returns null if Content-Disposition: header field value isn't set or Content-Disposition: header field "filename" parameter isn't set. Note: Content-Disposition must be attachment or inline.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Date:" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.MessageID
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Message-ID:" value. Returns null if value isn't set. Syntax: '<'id-left@id-right'>'. Example: <621bs724bfs8@jnfsjaas4263>

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.To
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Cc
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Cc:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Bcc
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Bcc:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.summary: Gets or sets header field "From:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Sender:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Reply-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.InReplyTo
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "In-Reply-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DSN
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Disposition-Notification-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Subject:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets entity data. Data is encoded/decoded with "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" header field value. Note: This property can be set only if Content-Type: isn't multipart.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DataText
member.summary: Gets or sets entity text data. Data is encoded/decoded with "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" header field value with this.Charset charset. Note: This property is available only if ContentType is Text/xxx... or no content type specified, othwerwise Excpetion is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DataEncoded
member.summary: Gets or sets entity encoded data. If you set this value, be sure that you encode this value as specified by Content-Transfer-Encoding: header field. Set this value only if you need custom Content-Transfer-Encoding: what current Mime class won't support, other wise set data through this.Data property. Note: This property can be set only if Content-Type: isn't multipart.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Source_Remote
member.summary: This class represents RTP remote source what we receive.
member.remarks: Source indicates an entity sending packets, either RTP and/or RTCP. Sources what send RTP packets are called "active", only RTCP sending ones are "passive".

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Source
member.summary: This class represents RTP source.
member.remarks: Source indicates an entity sending packets, either RTP and/or RTCP. Sources what send RTP packets are called "active", only RTCP sending ones are "passive". Source can be local(we send RTP and/or RTCP remote party) or remote(remote party sends RTP and/or RTCP to us).

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Packet
member.summary: A data packet consisting of the fixed RTP header, a possibly empty list of contributing sources (see below), and the payload data. Some underlying protocols may require an encapsulation of the RTP packet to be defined. Typically one packet of the underlying protocol contains a single RTP packet, but several RTP packets MAY be contained if permitted by the encapsulation method (see Section 11).

member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Coding method used in a MIME message body part.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets MIME content type. Value null means that header field does not exist. Defined in RFC 2045 5.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentBase
member.summary: Gets or sets base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Base to be used for resolving relative URIs within this content part. See also Content-Location.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets URI for retrieving a body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: URI using which the content of this body-part part was retrieved, might be retrievable, or which otherwise gives a globally unique identification of the content.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.Contentfeatures
member.summary: Gets or sets content features of a MIME body part. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: The 'Content-features:' header can be used to annotate a MIME body part with a media feature expression, to indicate features of the body part content. See also RFC 2533, RFC 2506, and RFC 2045.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets content disposition. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Indicates whether a MIME body part is to be shown inline or is an attachment; can also indicate a suggested filename for use when saving an attachment to a file.
member.exception: Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets language of message content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Can include a code for the natural language used in a message; e.g., 'en' for English. Can also contain a list of languages for a message containing more than one language.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentAlternative
member.summary: Gets or sets message alternative content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Information about the media features of alternative content formats available for the current message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentMD5
member.summary: Gets or sets content MD5 checksum. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Checksum of content to ensure that it has not been modified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Entity.ContentDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets time duration of content. Value null means that header field does not exist.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.
member.remarks: Time duration of body part content, in seconds (e.g., for audio message).

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.
Is raised when reading not supported.

member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

member.summary: Encodes specified data with bas64 encoding.

Padd missing block chars. Normal base64 must be 4 bytes blocks, if not 4 bytes in block, missing bytes must be padded with '='. Modified base64 just skips missing bytes.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition
member.summary: Represents "Content-Disposition:" header. Defined in RFC 2183.

example.code:
RFC 2183. In the extended BNF notation of [RFC 822], the Content-Disposition header field is defined as follows:
disposition := "Content-Disposition" ":" disposition-type *(";" disposition-parm)
disposition-type := "inline" / "attachment" / extension-token ; values are not case-sensitive
disposition-parm := filename-parm / creation-date-parm / modification-date-parm / read-date-parm / size-parm / parameter
filename-parm := "filename" "=" value
creation-date-parm := "creation-date" "=" quoted-date-time
modification-date-parm := "modification-date" "=" quoted-date-time
read-date-parm := "read-date" "=" quoted-date-time
size-parm := "size" "=" 1*DIGIT
quoted-date-time := quoted-string ; contents MUST be an RFC 822 `date-time' ; numeric timezones (+HHMM or -HHMM) MUST be used

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: The disposition-type. Known values are in MIME_DispositionTypes.
member.exception: Is raised when dispositionType is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.#ctor
member.summary: Internal parser constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses header field from the specified value.
member.param: Header field value. Header field name must be included. For example: 'Content-Type: text/plain'.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null reference.
Is raised when header field parsing errors.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.ToString(LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_Encoding_EncodedWord,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Returns header field as string.
member.param: 8-bit words ecnoder. Value null means that words are not encoded.
Charset to use to encode 8-bit characters. Value null means parameters not encoded.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.IsModified
member.summary: Gets if this header field is modified since it has loaded.
member.remarks: All new added header fields has IsModified = true.
member.exception: Is riased when this class is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Name
member.summary: Returns always "Content-Disposition".

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.DispositionType
member.summary: Gets the disposition-type. Known values are in MIME_DispositionTypes.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Parameters
member.summary: Gets Content-Type parameters collection.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Param_FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the suggested file name. Value DateTime.MinValue means not specified. Defined in RFC 2183 2.3.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Param_CreationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the creation date for a file. Value DateTime.MinValue means not specified. Defined in RFC 2183 2.4.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Param_ModificationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the modification date of a file. Value DateTime.MinValue means not specified. Defined in RFC 2183 2.5.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Param_ReadDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the last read date of a file. Value DateTime.MinValue means not specified. Defined in RFC 2183 2.6.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentDisposition.Param_Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of a file. Value -1 means not specified. Defined in RFC 2183 2.7.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_Multipart._MultipartReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.

member.summary: Writes sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.summary: Gets or sets 'duration' parameter value. The 'duration' parameter indicates how long the called party will be reachable starting at the initial time of availability. If no duration parameter is given, the service is assumed to be available indefinitely. Value -1 means not specified.
member.exception: Is raised when when value less than 1 is passed.

member.summary: Retrieves the number of waveform output devices present in the system.
member.returns: The number of devices indicates success. Zero indicates that no devices are present or that an error occurred.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetPosition(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the current playback position of the specified waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.
Size, in bytes, of the MMTIME structure.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutGetVolume(System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Queries the current volume setting of a waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to an open waveform-audio output device. This parameter can also be a device identifier.

Pointer to a variable to be filled with the current volume setting. The low-order word of this location contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutOpen(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX,LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.waveOutProc,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The waveOutOpen function opens the given waveform-audio output device for playback.
member.param: Pointer to a buffer that receives a handle identifying the open waveform-audio output device. Use the handle to identify the device when calling other waveform-audio output functions. This parameter might be NULL if the WAVE_FORMAT_QUERY flag is specified for fdwOpen.
Identifier of the waveform-audio output device to open. It can be either a device identifier or a handle of an open waveform-audio input device.
Pointer to a WAVEFORMATEX structure that identifies the format of the waveform-audio data to be sent to the device. You can free this structure immediately after passing it to waveOutOpen.

Pointer to a fixed callback function, an event handle, a handle to a window, or the identifier of a thread to be called during waveform-audio playback to process messages related to the progress of the playback. If no callback function is required, this value can be zero.
User-instance data passed to the callback mechanism.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WavMethods.waveOutPause(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Pauses playback on a specified waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.

member.summary: Prepares a waveform data block for playback.
member.param: Handle to the waveform-audio output device.
Pointer to a WAVEHDR structure that identifies the data block to be prepared. The buffer's base address must be aligned with the respect to the sample size.
Size, in bytes, of the WAVEHDR structure.

member.summary: Stops playback on a specified waveform output device and resets the current position to 0.

member.summary: Restarts a paused waveform output device.

member.summary: Sets the volume of a waveform output device.
member.param: Handle to an open waveform-audio output device. This parameter can also be a device identifier.

Specifies a new volume setting. The low-order word contains the left-channel volume setting, and the high-order word contains the right-channel setting. A value of 0xFFFF represents full volume, and a value of 0x0000 is silence.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEOUTCAPS.wReserved1
member.summary: Packing.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEOUTCAPS.dwSupport
member.summary: Optional functionality supported by the device.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX
member.summary: This class represents WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.wFormatTag
member.summary: Waveform-audio format type. Format tags are registered with Microsoft Corporation for many compression algorithms. A complete list of format tags can be found in the Mmreg.h header file. For one- or two-channel PCM data, this value should be WAVE_FORMAT_PCM. When this structure is included in a WAVEFORMATEXTENSIBLE structure, this value must be WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nChannels
member.summary: Number of channels in the waveform-audio data. Monaural data uses one channel and stereo data uses two channels.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nSamplesPerSec
member.summary: Sample rate, in samples per second (hertz). If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then common values for nSamplesPerSec are 8.0 kHz, 11.025 kHz, 22.05 kHz, and 44.1 kHz.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nAvgBytesPerSec
member.summary: Required average data-transfer rate, in bytes per second, for the format tag. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, nAvgBytesPerSec should be equal to the product of nSamplesPerSec and nBlockAlign.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.nBlockAlign
member.summary: Block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM or WAVE_FORMAT_EXTENSIBLE, nBlockAlign must be equal to the product of nChannels and wBitsPerSample divided by 8 (bits per byte).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.wBitsPerSample
member.summary: Bits per sample for the wFormatTag format type. If wFormatTag is WAVE_FORMAT_PCM, then wBitsPerSample should be equal to 8 or 16.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEFORMATEX.cbSize
member.summary: Size, in bytes, of extra format information appended to the end of the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR
member.summary: This class represents WAVEHDR structure.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.lpData
member.summary: Long pointer to the address of the waveform buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwBufferLength
member.summary: Specifies the length, in bytes, of the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwBytesRecorded
member.summary: When the header is used in input, this member specifies how much data is in the buffer. When the header is used in output, this member specifies the number of bytes played from the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwUser
member.summary: Specifies user data.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwFlags
member.summary: Specifies information about the buffer.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.dwLoops
member.summary: Specifies the number of times to play the loop.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Media.AudioOut.WaveOut.WAVEHDR.lpNext
member.summary: Reserved. This member is used within the audio driver to maintain a first-in, first-out linked list of headers awaiting playback.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mail.Mail_h_Received
member.summary: Represents "Received:" header. Defined in RFC 5321 4.4.

remarks.code:
RFC 5321 4.4. Time-stamp-line = "Received:" FWS Stamp CRLF
Stamp = From-domain By-domain Opt-info [CFWS] ";" FWS date-time ; where "date-time" is as defined in RFC 5322 [4] ; but the "obs-" forms, especially two-digit ; years, are prohibited in SMTP and MUST NOT be used.
From-domain = "FROM" FWS Extended-Domain
By-domain = CFWS "BY" FWS Extended-Domain
Extended-Domain = Domain / ( Domain FWS "(" TCP-info ")" ) / ( address-literal FWS "(" TCP-info ")" )
TCP-info = address-literal / ( Domain FWS address-literal ) ; Information derived by server from TCP connection not client EHLO.
Opt-info = [Via] [With] [ID] [For] [Additional-Registered-Clauses]
Via = CFWS "VIA" FWS Link
With = CFWS "WITH" FWS Protocol
ID = CFWS "ID" FWS ( Atom / msg-id ) ; msg-id is defined in RFC 5322 [4]
For = CFWS "FOR" FWS ( Path / Mailbox )
Additional-Registered-Clauses = CFWS Atom FWS String
Link = "TCP" / Addtl-Link
Addtl-Link = Atom
Protocol = "ESMTP" / "SMTP" / Attdl-Protocol
Mailbox = Local-part "@" ( Domain / address-literal )

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Host from where message was received.

member.summary: Sets stream position to the place we have consumed from stream and clears buffer data. For example if we have 10 byets in buffer, stream position is actually +10 bigger than we readed, the result is that stream.Position -= 10 and buffer is cleared.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.
Is raised when source stream won't support seeking.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SocketEx.ReadPeriodTerminated(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads period terminated string. The data is terminated by a line containing only a period, that is, the character sequence "<CRLF>.<CRLF>". When a line of text is received, it checks the line. If the line is composed of a single period, it is treated as the end of data indicator. If the first character is a period and there are other characters on the line, the first character is deleted. If maximum allowed data length is exceeded data is read to end, but isn't stored to buffer and exception is thrown after data reading.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SocketEx.ReadPeriodTerminated(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads period terminated data. The data is terminated by a line containing only a period, that is, the character sequence "<CRLF>.<CRLF>". When a line of text is received, it checks the line. If the line is composed of a single period, it is treated as the end of data indicator. If the first character is a period and there are other characters on the line, the first character is deleted. If maximum allowed data length is exceeded data is read to end, but isn't stored to stream and exception is thrown after data reading.
member.param: Stream where to store readed data.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState
member.summary: Implements SIP "Subscription-State" value. Defined in RFC 3265.

remarks.code: RFC 3265 Syntax: Subscription-State = substate-value *( SEMI subexp-params ) substate-value = "active" / "pending" / "terminated" / extension-substate extension-substate = token subexp-params = ("reason" EQUAL event-reason-value) / ("expires" EQUAL delta-seconds) / ("retry-after" EQUAL delta-seconds) / generic-param event-reason-value = "deactivated" / "probation" / "rejected" / "timeout" / "giveup" / "noresource" / event-reason-extension event-reason-extension = token

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Parses "Subscription-State" from specified value.

member.exception: Is raised when negative value(except -1) is passed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.RetryAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets 'expires' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified.
member.exception: Is raised when negative value(except -1) is passed.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
member.summary: This class holds 'substate-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.active
member.summary: The subscription has been accepted and (in general) has been authorized.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.pending
member.summary: The subscription has been received by the notifier, but there is insufficient policy information to grant or deny the subscription yet.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.terminated
member.summary: The subscriber should consider the subscription terminated.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason
member.summary: This class holds 'event-reason-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.deactivated
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the subscriber SHOULD retry immediately with a new subscription. One primary use of such a status code is to allow migration of subscriptions between nodes. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "deactivated".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.probation
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the client SHOULD retry at some later time. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.rejected
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated due to change in authorization policy. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "rejected".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.timeout
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because it was not refreshed before it expired. Clients MAY re-subscribe immediately. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "timeout".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.giveup
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the notifier could not obtain authorization in a timely fashion. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe; otherwise, the client MAY retry immediately, but will likely get put back into pending state.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.noresource
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the resource state which was being monitored no longer exists. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "noresource".

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType
member.summary: Proccess directives. Defined in rfc 3841 9.1.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Proxy
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to proxy request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Redirect
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to redirect request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Cancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoCancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would NOT want each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Fork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should fork a request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoFork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should proxy to only a single address. The server SHOULD proxy the request to the "best" address (generally the one with the highest q-value).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Recurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should send requests to the addresses listed in the response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoRecurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should forward the list of addresses upstream towards the caller.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Parallel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to proxy the request to all known addresses at once.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Sequential
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to go through all known addresses sequentially, contacting the next address only after it has received a non-2xx or non-6xx final response for the previous one.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Queue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller wants to have its call queued.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoQueue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller don't want its call to be queued.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_MultipartAlternative
member.summary: This class represents MIME multipart/alternative body. Defined in RFC 2046 5.1.4.
member.remarks: The "multipart/alternative" is intended for use when each of the body parts is an "alternative" version of the same information. member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6. Content-Transfer-Encoding. Specified how entity data is encoded.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._7bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.7. 7bit data. "7bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._8bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.8. 8bit data. "8bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]), but octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. As with "7bit data" CR and LF octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences and no NULs are allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Binary
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.9. Binary data. "Binary data" refers to data where any sequence of octets whatsoever is allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.7 Quoted-Printable Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Base64
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.8 Base64 Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.NotSpecified
member.summary: Content-Transfer-Encoding field isn't available(doesn't exist).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Unknown
member.summary: Content transfer encoding is unknown.

member.remarks: The Multipart/Report Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) content-type is a general "family" or "container" type for electronic mail reports of any kind.

member.summary: Parses body from the specified stream
member.param: MIME media type. For example: text/plain.
Stream from where to read body.
member.exception: Is raised when stream, mediaType or stream is null reference.
Is raised when any parsing errors.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_b_MultipartMixed
member.summary: This class represents MIME multipart/mixed body. Defined in RFC 2046 5.1.3.
member.remarks: The "mixed" subtype of "multipart" is intended for use when the body parts are independent and need to be bundled in a particular order.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp
member.summary: Implements SIP "Timestamp" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: Timestamp = 1*(DIGIT) [ "." *(DIGIT) ] [ LWS delay ] delay = *(DIGIT) [ "." *(DIGIT) ]

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.#ctor(System.Decimal,System.Decimal)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Time in seconds when request was sent.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses "Timestamp" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.Parse(LumiSoft.Net.StringReader)
member.summary: Parses "Timestamp" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.ToStringValue
member.summary: Converts this to valid "Timestamp" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets time in seconds when request was sent.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Timestamp.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets delay time in seconds. Delay specifies the time between the UAS received the request and generated response.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_From
member.summary: Implements SIP "From" value. Defined in RFC 3261. The From header field indicates the initiator of the request.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: From = ( name-addr / addr-spec ) *( SEMI from-param ) from-param = tag-param / generic-param tag-param = "tag" EQUAL token

member.exception: Raised when value is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.summary: Parses "From" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.

member.summary: Gets address.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_From.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets tag parameter value. The "tag" parameter serves as a general mechanism for dialog identification. Value null means that tag paramter doesn't exist.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_CSeq
member.summary: Implements SIP "Cseq" value. Defined in RFC 3261. A CSeq in a request contains a single decimal sequence number and the request method. The method part of CSeq is case-sensitive. The CSeq header field serves to order transactions within a dialog, to provide a means to uniquely identify transactions, and to differentiate between new requests and request retransmissions.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: CSeq = 1*DIGIT LWS Method

member.summary: Parses "CSeq" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when value is null.

member.summary: Parses "CSeq" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.summary: Converts this to valid "CSeq" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_CSeq.SequenceNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets sequence number.

member.summary: Gets or sets request method. Note: this value is case-sensitive !

member.summary: This enum specifies SIP proxy server 'forking' mode.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.None
member.summary: No forking. The contact with highest q value is used.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.Parallel
member.summary: All contacts are processed parallel at same time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ForkingMode.Sequential
member.summary: In a sequential search, a proxy server attempts each contact address in sequence, proceeding to the next one only after the previous has generated a final response. Contacts are processed from highest q value to lower.

Parses [quoted] parameter from args text. Parameter may be not quoted, then parameter is terminated by SP. Example: argsText="string gdkga agkgs";argsText=stringValue 10.
This method also removes parsed parameter from argsText.

member.summary:
Parses bracket parameter from args text. Parameter may be not between (), then then args text is considered as value. Example: (test test);test test.
This method also removes parsed parameter from argsText.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream
member.summary: This class combines multiple stream into one stream for reading. The most common usage for that stream is when you need to insert some data to the beginning of some stream.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up any resources being used.

member.summary: Appends this stream to read queue.

Is raised when stream is null.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current stream. This method is not supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.
Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream. This method is not supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.
Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.MultiStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written. This method is not supported and always throws a NotSupportedException.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this method is accessed.
Is raised when this method is accessed.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.exception: Is raised when this object is disposed and this property is accessed.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags
member.summary: SIP Option Tags. Defined in RFC 3261 27.1, defined values are in: http://www.iana.org/assignments/sip-parameters.
member.remarks: Option tags are used in header fields such as Require, Supported, Proxy-Require, and Unsupported in support of SIP compatibility mechanisms for extensions (Section 19.2). The option tag itself is a string that is associated with a particular SIP option (that is, an extension).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.x100rel
member.summary: This option tag is for reliability of provisional responses. When present in a Supported header, it indicates that the UA can send or receive reliable provisional responses. When present in a Require header in a request it indicates that the UAS MUST send all provisional responses reliably. When present in a Require header in a reliable provisional response, it indicates that the response is to be sent reliably. Defined in rfc 3262.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.early_session
member.summary: A UA adding the early-session option tag to a message indicates that it understands the early-session content disposition. Defined in rfc 3959.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.eventlist
member.summary: Extension to allow subscriptions to lists of resources. Defined in rfc 4662.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.histinfo
member.summary: When used with the Supported header, this option tag indicates support for the History Information to be captured for requests and returned in subsequent responses. This tag is not used in a Proxy-Require or Require header field since support of History-Info is optional. Defined in rfc 4244.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.join
member.summary: Support for the SIP Join Header. Defined in rfc 3911.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.norefersub
member.summary: This option tag specifies a User Agent ability of accepting a REFER request without establishing an implicit subscription (compared to the default case defined in RFC3515). Defined in rfc 3911.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.path
member.summary: A SIP UA that supports the Path extension header field includes this option tag as a header field value in a Supported header field in all requests generated by that UA. Intermediate proxies may use the presence of this option tag in a REGISTER request to determine whether to offer Path service for for that request. If an intermediate proxy requires that the registrar support Path for a request, then it includes this option tag as a header field value in a Requires header field in that request. Defined in rfc 3327.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.precondition
member.summary: An offerer MUST include this tag in the Require header field if the offer contains one or more "mandatory" strength-tags. If all the strength-tags in the description are "optional" or "none" the offerer MUST include this tag either in a Supported header field or in a Require header field. Defined in rfc 3312.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.pref
member.summary: This option tag is used to ensure that a server understands the callee capabilities parameters used in the request. Defined in rfc 3840.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.privacy
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the Privacy mechanism. When used in the Proxy-Require header, it indicates that proxy servers do not forward the request unless they can provide the requested privacy service. This tag is not used in the Require or Supported headers. Proxies remove this option tag before forwarding the request if the desired privacy function has been performed. Defined in rfc 3323.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.replaces
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the SIP Replaces header. Defined in rfc 3891.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.resource_priority
member.summary: Indicates or requests support for the resource priority mechanism. Defined in rfc 4412.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.sdp_anat
member.summary: The option-tag sdp-anat is defined for use in the Require and Supported SIP [RFC3261] header fields. SIP user agents that place this option-tag in a Supported header field understand the ANAT semantics as defined in [RFC4091]. Defined in rfc 4092.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.sec_agree
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Require, or Proxy-Require headers, it indicates that proxy servers are required to use the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Supported header, it indicates that the User Agent Client supports the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Require header in the 494 (Security Agreement Required) or 421 (Extension Required) responses, it indicates that the User Agent Client must use the Security Agreement Mechanism. Defined in rfc 3329.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.tdialog
member.summary: This option tag is used to identify the target dialog header field extension. When used in a Require header field, it implies that the recipient needs to support the Target-Dialog header field. When used in a Supported header field, it implies that the sender of the message supports it. Defined in rfc 4538.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.timer
member.summary: This option tag is for support of the session timer extension. Inclusion in a Supported header field in a request or response indicates that the UA is capable of performing refreshes according to that specification. Inclusion in a Require header in a request means that the UAS must understand the session timer extension to process the request. Inclusion in a Require header field in a response indicates that the UAC must look for the Session-Expires header field in the response, and process accordingly. Defined in rfc 4028.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.AddressList
member.summary:
Rfc 2822 3.4 address-list. Rfc defines two types of addresses mailbox and group.
address-list syntax: address *("," address).
address syntax: mailbox / group.
mailbox syntax: ['"'dispaly-name'"' ]<localpart@domain>.
group syntax: '"'dispaly-name'":' [mailbox *(',' mailbox)]';'.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_h_ContentType
member.summary: Represents "Content-Type:" header. Defined in RFC 2045 5.1.

remarks.code:
RFC 2045 5.1. In the Augmented BNF notation of RFC 822, a Content-Type header field value is defined as follows:
content := "Content-Type" ":" type "/" subtype *(";" parameter) ; Matching of media type and subtype ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
type := discrete-type / composite-type
discrete-type := "text" / "image" / "audio" / "video" / "application" / extension-token
composite-type := "message" / "multipart" / extension-token
extension-token := ietf-token / x-token
ietf-token := (An extension token defined by a standards-track RFC and registered with IANA.)
x-token := (The two characters "X-" or "x-" followed, with no intervening white space, by any token)
subtype := extension-token / iana-token
iana-token := (A publicly-defined extension token. Tokens of this form must be registered with IANA as specified in RFC 2048.)
parameter := attribute "=" value
attribute := token ; Matching of attributes ; is ALWAYS case-insensitive.
value := token / quoted-string
token := 1*(any (US-ASCII) CHAR except SPACE, CTLs,or tspecials)
tspecials := "(" / ")" / "<" / ">" / "@" / "," / ";" / ":" / "\" / " "/" / "[" / "]" / "?" / "=" ; Must be in quoted-string, ; to use within parameter values

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm
member.summary: Implements SIP "via-parm" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code:
RFC 3261 Syntax: via-parm = sent-protocol LWS sent-by *( SEMI via-params ) via-params = via-ttl / via-maddr / via-received / via-branch / via-extension via-ttl = "ttl" EQUAL ttl via-maddr = "maddr" EQUAL host via-received = "received" EQUAL (IPv4address / IPv6address) via-branch = "branch" EQUAL token via-extension = generic-param sent-protocol = protocol-name SLASH protocol-version SLASH transport protocol-name = "SIP" / token protocol-version = token transport = "UDP" / "TCP" / "TLS" / "SCTP" / other-transport sent-by = host [ COLON port ] ttl = 1*3DIGIT ; 0 to 255
Via extentions: // RFC 3486 via-compression = "comp" EQUAL ("sigcomp" / other-compression) // RFC 3581 response-port = "rport" [EQUAL 1*DIGIT]

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm.#ctor
member.summary: Defualt constructor.

member.summary: Creates new branch paramter value.

member.summary: Parses "via-parm" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm.Parse(LumiSoft.Net.StringReader)
member.summary: Parses "via-parm" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SecMechanism
member.summary: Implements SIP "sec-mechanism" value. Defined in RFC 3329.

remarks.code: RFC 3329 Syntax: sec-mechanism = mechanism-name *(SEMI mech-parameters) mechanism-name = ( "digest" / "tls" / "ipsec-ike" / "ipsec-man" / token ) mech-parameters = ( preference / digest-algorithm / digest-qop / digest-verify / extension ) preference = "q" EQUAL qvalue qvalue = ( "0" [ "." 0*3DIGIT ] ) / ( "1" [ "." 0*3("0") ] ) digest-algorithm = "d-alg" EQUAL token digest-qop = "d-qop" EQUAL token digest-verify = "d-ver" EQUAL LDQUOT 32LHEX RDQUOT extension = generic-param

member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.
Is raised when reading not supported.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.IO.ReadWriteControlledStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: Is raised when buffer is null reference.
Is raised when any of the arguments has invalid value.
Is raised when reading not supported.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType
member.summary: Specifies UDP network type.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.UdpBlocked
member.summary: UDP is always blocked.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.OpenInternet
member.summary: No NAT, public IP, no firewall.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.SymmetricUdpFirewall
member.summary: No NAT, public IP, but symmetric UDP firewall.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.FullCone
member.summary: A full cone NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port are mapped to the same external IP address and port. Furthermore, any external host can send a packet to the internal host, by sending a packet to the mapped external address.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.RestrictedCone
member.summary: A restricted cone NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port are mapped to the same external IP address and port. Unlike a full cone NAT, an external host (with IP address X) can send a packet to the internal host only if the internal host had previously sent a packet to IP address X.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.PortRestrictedCone
member.summary: A port restricted cone NAT is like a restricted cone NAT, but the restriction includes port numbers. Specifically, an external host can send a packet, with source IP address X and source port P, to the internal host only if the internal host had previously sent a packet to IP address X and port P.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.Symmetric
member.summary: A symmetric NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port, to a specific destination IP address and port, are mapped to the same external IP address and port. If the same host sends a packet with the same source address and port, but to a different destination, a different mapping is used. Furthermore, only the external host that receives a packet can send a UDP packet back to the internal host.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_SequenceSet
member.summary:
IMAP sequence-set. RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)
NOTES: *) comma separates sequence parts *) * means maximum value.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings
member.summary: This class holds MIME content transfer encodings. Defined in RFC 2045 6.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.SevenBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line of the code range 1..127 with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. This is the default value. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.EightBit
member.summary: Up to 998 octets per line with CR and LF (codes 13 and 10 respectively) only allowed to appear as part of a CRLF line ending. Defined in RFC 2045 6.2.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Designed to be efficient and mostly human readable when used for text data consisting primarily of US-ASCII characters but also containing a small proportion of bytes with values outside that range. Defined in RFC 2045 6.7.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Base64
member.summary: Used to encode arbitrary octet sequences into a form that satisfies the rules of 7bit. Has a fixed overhead and is intended for non text data and text that is not ASCII heavy. Defined in RFC 2045 6.8.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.MIME.MIME_TransferEncodings.Binary
member.summary: Any sequence of octets. This type is not widely used. Defined in RFC 3030.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri
member.summary: Implements SIP-URI. Defined in 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: SIP-URI = "sip:" [ userinfo ] hostport uri-parameters [ headers ] SIPS-URI = "sips:" [ userinfo ] hostport uri-parameters [ headers ] userinfo = ( user / telephone-subscriber ) [ ":" password ] "@") hostport = host [ ":" port ] host = hostname / IPv4address / IPv6reference

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Parse SIP or SIPS URI from string value.
member.exception: Is raised when value is null reference.
Is raised when value is not valid SIP or SIPS URI.

member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: Returns true if two objects are equal.

member.summary: Returns the hash code.

member.summary: Parses SIP_Uri from SIP-URI string.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Scheme
member.summary: Gets URI scheme.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.IsSecure
member.summary: Gets or sets if secure SIP. If true then sips: uri, otherwise sip: uri.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Address
member.summary: Gets address from SIP URI. Examples: ivar@lumisoft.ee,ivar@195.222.10.1.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.User
member.summary: Gets or sets user name. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets host name or IP.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets host port. Value -1 means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.HostPort
member.summary: Gets host with optional port. If port specified returns Host:Port, otherwise Host.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Parameters
member.summary: Gets URI parameters.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Cause
member.summary: Gets or sets 'cause' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Cause is a URI parameter that is used to indicate the service that the User Agent Server (UAS) receiving the message should perform. Defined in RFC 4458.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Comp
member.summary: Gets or sets 'comp' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3486.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets 'content-type' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets 'delay' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies a delay interval between announcement repetitions. The delay is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets 'duration' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies the maximum duration of the announcement. The media server will discontinue the announcement and end the call if the maximum duration has been reached. The duration is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets 'locale' prameter value. Specifies the language and optionally country variant of the announcement sequence named in the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Lr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'lr' parameter. The lr parameter, when present, indicates that the element responsible for this resource implements the routing mechanisms specified in this document. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Maddr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'maddr' parameter value. Value null means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The maddr parameter indicates the server address to be contacted for this user, overriding any address derived from the host field. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Method
member.summary: Gets or sets 'method' prameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Play
member.summary: Gets or sets 'play' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Specifies the resource or announcement sequence to be played. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets 'repeat' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified, value int.MaxValue means 'forever'. Specifies how many times the media server should repeat the announcement or sequence named by the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Target
member.summary: Gets or sets 'target' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Transport
member.summary: Gets or sets 'transport' parameter value. Value null means not specified. The transport parameter determines the transport mechanism to be used for sending SIP messages. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Ttl
member.summary: Gets or sets 'ttl' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The ttl parameter determines the time-to-live value of the UDP multicast packet and MUST only be used if maddr is a multicast address and the transport protocol is UDP. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_User
member.summary: Gets or sets 'user' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Param_Voicexml
member.summary: Gets or sets 'voicexml' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP_Uri.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets header.
